intro: Astragalus orites, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature. Astragalus orites is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
